The wine list is quite competent, if not showy, and that itself is an accomplishment. Servers are about what you find in Madison; folksy friendly but sloppy on the water pour. I enjoyed them regardless. If I could improve on the experience, I'd hire a lighting designer, buy bread out and get a good cleaning service to scrub the floors which seemed a little dingy along the edges.   I'd go back. And definitely ask for the red banquette.
The food was so good that I don't want to brush my teeth for a month at the off chance a fleck of meat might drop on my tongue

This place is supposed to have the best steak in Madison.  It is very good, but I'm not sure it's the best.  My date got the $37 special for the night...a very thick steak, beautiful cut of meat.  The only problem is that he ordered it well (I know, we won't be going out again!) which meant that the outside was almost charcoaled but the inside was still pink!  I got rabbit ($18) in a portabella wine sauce which was very good.  Portions are definitely generous!  The service was fantastic. They seemed to have a girl whose sole purpose in life was to fill water glasses...as soon as I took a drink she was there to fill it up again!  Our main waitress was very attentive and they place had a good crowd even on a Wednesday night!  I've also been here for drinks before, which was fun...the waitresses are very friendly...which might have been because we came with cute boys, but who knows?

I think this place is wonderful. They bring this strange relish thing to the table, yes you can eat it. It's raw carrots, celery, a radish, a tomato, a cucumber, two olives, a green onion and a pickle. Then they bring home baked bread To the table which is quite good. I've tried both the French onion and their chicken noodle soup. Their French Onion is great. Their  chicken noodle is amazing but it's a teeny tiny portion. I absolutely LOVE their flank steak. It's a large portion for a great price served with the option of potato or vegetable. And it's delicious. I absolutely love it. Their service is amazing across the board (wait staff wise). I've yet to have a bad server here. If you are seated on the patio it is a little warm because it's like in an alcove. And people from the corral room downstairs love to go outside and smoke a bunch of cigarettes but it isn't unbearable, it's just obnoxious. The dining room is very dimly lit, and it has poor cell phone reception, but you don't go to a restaurant like this to be on Snapchat.

I returned here on a Tuesday night afterwork. I won't go into the atmosphere since I described that in my first post. This time I decided to try the bison ribeye, which was really good. Tender with mushrooms / sauce that was delicious. The only reason I didn't give this review a five was due to the fact that although my entree was good, I don't believe the meat was cooked enough to fully render all of the fat. That being said I did order the steak rare, so partially my fault. If I were to order this item again I'd probably order medium rare. My colleague ordered the smaller of the filets, which I tasted and that was fantastic!  I'm not sure how busy it gets on later week nights, but since they do take reservations you might as well make one prior to going just to be safe. Both times I went here we were able to make reservations the day of.

I hesitated writing a bad review for Tornado because it's always had good ratings but we were not impressed with the food on this trip. We had reservations but had to wait twenty minutes or more and the bar was full so had to stand around by the back door. We were finally seated but the service was slow (it was busy as usual) and it was a long wait between courses. Our server was excellent so apparently the kitchen was overwhelmed and just couldn't keep up with the demand.. The ice berg wedge salad was very good but by now it's getting late and we were getting a little cranky. Nine thirty or so and we still haven't got our steaks, our reservations were for 7:30. When I finally got my New York strip I found it was not only tough but someone decided to put a garlic spice on top that completely overwhelmed the meat. It managed to leak into my hash browns and ruin the tase of that as well. Yuck!  It was so late my now I gagged down what I could and left the rest. It was too late to send it back and I didn't make a fuss. A forty dollar mistake. My wife got a tenderloin and it too had a spice of cracked pepper and stuff on top but not the garlic. It was excellent. (Two of us got the New York strip and they were both the same as I described)  So, we were not impressed and it will be a long time before we go back. Certainly not on a weekend. There are better places.

First time there last week and I couldn't have been more satisfied.  We sat in the lounge for dinner and it was elegant and intimate.  The service was average but sufficient, but it didn't matter because the food and atmosphere were exactly what we were looking for- ample portions, one of the best steaks I've ever had, and a salad and side included, which is a nice addition that differs from many other steak houses in town (Johnny Delmonicos, Flemings, and others), all in a dark, cozy Wisconsin supper club.    I haven't heard of anywhere else in town that can top the Tornado Room in terms of value, taste, and location.
This place is retro cool and has the added bonus of great food. The paneling is awesome as are the light fixtures, the bar and the bar booths. Plus I love the Walleye and the Duck.

I have been wanting to check out their late night menu for the longest! I finally found myself in the area starving at 10:15pm and knew it was time to scope out Tornado's.   I ordered the steak sandwich and salmon burger. The salmon burger was really good, but I eat a lot of salmon burgers and it didn't wow me too much. However, ommmmgggg the steak sandwich is to die for! The steak was thinly sliced and stacked quite high. The sandwich came with a dipping sauce that paired excellently. The ambiance in the bar area was perfect.  The area was dimly lit with table seating on the side of the bar. The service was also very good.
Awesome place for late-night drinks. Service was great, and our server, Christen, was charismatic and friendly. The atmosphere was excellent and we had a great time!
Love the atmosphere in there. Always great service, excellent cocktails, and delicious late hours menu. Oh and nice comfy chairs and seating too.
Great cocktails!  Brandy old fashioned was a work if art.  Salad was great, but steak was completely forgettable.  The bar is highly recommended

The drink I was served wasn't even the right recipe. The bartender insisted it was right even thought I told him it was not right...I should know I only get it every where I go. I think his name was Tom. Think he was on drugs or something. Overall very rude and I will not be going back to this establishment because of him. Didn't even order food the experience was so bad. Johnny del'monico for me from here on out.

I concur with Matt M. about this restaurant.  Read good things about it and wanted to like it but the food was just not good. Soup was bland. Baked potato was almost cold, hard & chunky when it should be fluffy, hot & fall apart easily.  The filet..sigh..I was so looking forward to a melt in your mouth, perfectly cooked steak from a high end steak house. It might have been melt in your mouth if the cook (I won't say chef since everything but the bread and uncooked shrimp cocktail were poorly done.) could have gotten the tempature right. I felt awful but had to send it back twice and just gave up after the second time. The tempature isn't just the literal temperature but the texture INSIDE the the steak as well. Medium rare shouldn't look and feel like a semi raw muscle but be cooked all the way through to a bright reddish pink where you cut into it and it's so juicy it bleeds.  This was still looking and feeling like muscle.  A real shame since it felt like it would have been tender if prepared properly to my tastes.  On the plus side, my server was excellent.  She was attentive and apologetic when the steak wasn't working out.  Took the steak off my bill and offered desert.  Although now that i think of it, nowadays most restaurants have their manager come around even when everything is going well.  So very disappointing that no one other than my server checked on me.  Especially with an issue.  Overall just a disappointing experience when I WANTED to be able to like it so much.  The stars it gets are because of my server.

This is a place to definitely make reservations for.  While I enjoyed the food and service,  i expected a bit more for the price.  My friend and i were seated in a back room which housed the large parties.  We had to yell to order and couldn't hear each other throughout the meal.  Sitting outside would have been the better option.  The meal starts with fresh vegetables and several homemade breads.  Great wine selection.  We both had prime rib.  Mine was a bit overcooked.  My vegetable side was too salty,  my friends hashbrowns are undercooked.  The Giant bread muffin that it came with melts in your mouth.  Yum!

Disclaimer: I haven't even been here for dinner yet, and I know it is one of the best in Madison.  I went in for a late night snack and was very happy to see that the steak sandwich was only $9. The meat was so incredibly tender and juicy. The cocktail I ordered was very well-made, as well.  I can't wait to go here for dinner some time. Perhaps I'll bring a date with me.

AMAZING!  Went there with a bunch of friends and had a great time.  We were 20 minutes late and felt really bad about holding up the table, but they were very gracious and seated us all and didn't hurry us.  I ordered the 8 oz filet and it was cooked a perfect medium rare.  Really the best steak I've had in years and definitely the best in Madison.  Yummy sides, too.  The service was top notch -- from the bartender to our waiter to the food runners.   It doesn't look like much from the outside, but don't be fooled.  Inside the bar and the dining rooms are pretty nice.  Good lighting, lively atmosphere.    It's expensive, but TOTALLY worth it.

Trip back in time, legit supper club, very rat packy  Stopped in for dinner on a Saturday and were seated in the Corral room.  Very retro vibe.  Friendly and attentive waiters.  Started out with the brandy old fashioned. very nice start.  Liked the bread stick and the vegetables.  Had the beer cheese soup, which was ok.  I thought it had a bit of a burned taste and didn't really like the flavor, I've noticed this before with some other beer cheese soups.  Had the 8oz Fillet as the entree.  Wow.  Served on a sizzling plate from the oven.  Delicious, very tasty, a memorable steak.  Would definitely go back.  And to Heidi B - there is such a thing as the internet which among other things lists menus, so you don't have to rely on word of mouth about the menu.  In fact both the Tornado website and this very website list their menus, why were you confused about the menu and its prices being "different than what you were told" and then why do you review a place that you haven't eaten at?

Old school setting and great service help overcome an uneven menu. My onion soup was unremarkable, lukewarm  and didn't have much of a crust. However, the venison was amazing (medium rare). Unfortunately the Brussels sprouts that came with were undercooked.   We ordered multiple desserts and the standouts were the lemon tart and especially the chocolate caramel tart.   PS - did try a companions hashbrowns and those rocked as well!

Used to be one of our favorite places.   We drive up from Chicago.  Last night was not a good experience.  They offered to make a grilled cheese for my 2 1/2 year old and proceeded to charge us $15 for it .  I am not cheap but that is ridiculious!

My friend suggested this supper club as a "taste of Madison" for my first visit to the city/state. We had the BEST meal there. Our server was great, we did not have to wait for a table (sometimes even though I've made a reservation I still have to wait) and the food was AMAZING. We had the scallop appetizer which was the best scallop dish I've ever had.  Our wonderful server recommended eating the greens that we thought were just decoration/garnish.  It was delicious! Then we shared the lamb and the prime rib.  Huge portions.  We were able to share and take some home. The lamb came encrusted with a horseradish/wasabi and a sweet red wine sauce. The rib-eye was traditional, but cooked exceptionally well. I also recommend the Brandy Old Fashioned.

Average and sometimes ill-prepared steaks, best late-night menu in Madison, classy place with excellent service.   I've had the t-bone and the strip. Nothing wrong with either, though the t-bone was a little 'blue' near the bone, and the strip inexplicably lacked marbling or robust flavor. They're not especially seared or charred, not overly seasoned, and not 'prime'. So what you end up with is a fairly large, not terribly priced steak that's unfortunately a little bland.   That said, I think their hash browns, which come in a strange circular pillow formation, are just about the best hash browns I've ever had, and this is compared to literally dozens of other interpretations over the years. I also like their bread basket, almost certainly the best in town. They also have amazing burgers and steak fries after 10pm.  Not positive that I'd recommend this place unless someone wanted good atmosphere and a seriously large chunk of cow...and wasn't too picky.

I can't begin to express my disappointment. I'm not a regular, but have been here many times and for the most part look forward to coming back.  Tonight.... not so much. Worst service ever and not just here but anywhere!  Our Waitress worked her darnedest to, make service at MacDonalds look good.  My steak had a nasty smell and an even worse flavor.  I had one bite and would have sent it back but she never came back to ask how our meal was. I could have left without paying but went to the bar and waited.... still no Waitress.  So, I went to the hostess desk and told them who I was and that I was waiting in the bar for the bill. Finally she showed up, I told her my displeasure with the steak, which she took off the bill. Not tip for her other than to say she should find a welding job because being a waitress wasn't where she should be.  It will be a struggle to go back.

Still consistently amazing!   Tara has been a great server over the years, you are lucky if you get her, tip well.   The dinner menu is great, try the rabbit, or dry aged steaks.   The late night menu keeps delivering year after year, and the scallops are still the best in the midwest.

This place is a must...One of the best steaks I've ever had, one of the best meals I've ever had.  I personally  recommend eating in the hip lounge area if your a small group,  the dining room doesn't do this place justice.

Due to a combination of both it being my first time travelling for work and me just being the utter most forgetful person ever, promptly after dining at this fine establishment, I forgot my receipt at the table. This was also after being THOSE patrons who ask for separate (from each other, and separate tabs for food and alcohol) AND itemized checks. Hate on me now, I deserve it. I intended to eat the cost of my meal and forget trying to get reimbursed for it, but figured it would be worth a shot to give the restaurant a call and see if they'd email me my receipt. They couldn't, but what they could do is mail a copy of my receipt to my home address (!!!!)  Long story short, I returned home a week later but didn't expect much. But lo and behold, to my surprise was an envelope from Tornado Steak House. My receipt, and even a postcard! Sweeeeeet. My impression of this place from our dining experience was already great, but their phenomenal above and beyond service just makes this restaurant even more awesome!  Anywho, this was our first meal in Madison and we came based on a recommendation by a friend and we were absolutely starving. So we had no idea what to expect, and walked in sans reservations. Luckily we were early and were able to snag a table, but do make reservations if you plan on coming during the typical dinner rush because our section was packed by the time we left! The vibe of the restaurant is very classic steakhouse, dimly lit and a little romantic with illuminated (real!) candles at each table. Service was spectacular and so accommodating from beginning to end, even though like I mentioned, we were literally the most annoying guests ever with our multiple check requests. (Sorry!)   I totally skipped getting any other appetizers and promptly told the waiter I'd have the 16 oz New York Strip. Good thinking, since all the steaks DO come with a salad (or a soup, I think) as well as your choice of a side! I think for ~$30 and some change, this is a great value since some places will charge you that much or even more for just an ala carte steak! The salad was pretty standard, but nice, crisp and fresh. There are a nice handful of options for sides you might find at any typical steakhouse (potatoes and the like) but I made an oops by choosing the roasted veggies, because apparently my tastebuds hate endives. The roasted veggies do change seasonally, so I'll make a note to skip endive season in the future. The star of the show of course was the steak, which was of gargantuan proportions. As much as I tried, I wasn't even able to tackle half of that thing! Really delicious though, and cooked to medium rare perfection, as I requested.  The veggie appetizer you're presented with upon sitting down is pretty cool, although we had no idea WTF it was at first. And they have a nice variety of house breads too, but I'd say skip the bread and save the stomach real estate for your entrée, you'll need it!

It's been almost a year since we last came here and had a terrible experience, so we decided enough time had passed and we can give it another go.  We walked up to the hostess stand and she was on the phone. From our previous review of this place, that didn't end well. Luckily, she hung up the phone quickly and greeted us warmly, stating she'll seat us in less than 5 minutes.  We started out with the frog legs....which was interesting. It wasn't a bad taste, but once was enough. The sauce it was drenched in was pretty good though.  He had the Filet Au Poivre....10 oz sirloin with peppercorn and mushroom sauce...or something like that. He loved it, and the bite I got was also tasty. He was pleased it was cooked exactly to his liking (MEDIUM). He was also pleased about the tenderness of the meat.  I had the 8oz sirloin and it had a random huge onion ring on top of it. It had more breading than the actual onion itself, so I set it aside for the boyfriend to eat. My steak didn't have all the sauce and hoopla, but still good. The only thing I wasn't happy about was struggling to slice some pieces of it with a knife.   Our server was very nice as well. She deserved to be tipped twice. =)  Happy we gave this a second chance. Will definitely put this restaurant back on our list.

This place never fails!!! Perfect date night place, or place to bring your parents to prove you've "made it" Best steaks in town, great service, plenty of wine to choose from, huge portions! Pricey? Maybe. Worth it?? Yes!!!
Simply overrated! Money well spent somewhere else! Ordered a T bone steak medium rare but got it well done. Very expensive for the quality of the food.

I had to come here for a client dinner ... Right when they said steak house I was sad.. I was pretty sure I couldn't eat anything here because I was vegetarian... I called in ahead of time and asked if they had options because I didn't see anything on the menu .. and voila they said they can do something for me .. they did scalloped potatoes and this fancy pants vegetable dish .. it was great.. I also had the cheese platter .. it was a A+ in my books

This place is awesome. Head in there for the late night menu if you can swing the hours...... I don't want to give too much away because I think it's a really powerful/romantic place to enjoy a meal, so if you're considering going- definitely go.

We chose this place for the combination of  steaks and seafood. To my surprise they offered venison which I paired with a potato pancake. My tip when ordering venison is to simply let the chef prepare, never choose a doneness, I was so overwhelmed with the perfection of the preparation, I talked about it the rest of the night. The rest of our party of 8 had steaks, salmon, and shrimp, all of which were large portions and done properly. Don't be impatient for the meals to arrive, they will show up proper.  Cold vegetables , radish, cucumbers, olives, and more served complimentary keep you busy while drinking great wines and chatting.
Got The oysters and they were so bad ! :( Otherwise nice place  Stakes are pretty good
Overall it is a bit on the pricier side. The frog legs were not that great as touted out to be but the steaks were awesome !

LOUD atmosphere at regular dinner time, excellent filets, service OK--server was really anxious.  This is an all-wood-paneling-sound-travels type of place. Initially, we couldn't hear each other talk. We could clearly hear the booth Across the dining room from us; lots of echoing at the Tornado. The booth next to us had 4 loud boomers that yell when talking and were singing at one point, but we hadn't been here before so we stayed.  Not the place for a quiet birthday dinner. I mentioned it was my husband's birthday when I made the reservation, they don't do anything special, unlike Delaney's on the west side which makes birthdays really special.  Food: Filets were perfectly cooked. The filet au poivre was bland. Brussels were undercooked, asparagus was crisp tender. Included salad and bread was nice touch.  If you are in the mood to get loud and remember the past, go here.  For a quiet celebration, keep looking.  I'll probably try again only for late night..

Our son took us here  on Nov 5, 2011.  Called for reservations on Tuesday Nov. 1 for reservations for four.  Had a choice of 5:15 or 9:15.  Took 5:15.  When we arrived it was pretty empty but within  a half an hour it was getting full.   Very dark. Lots of wood. Jazz music playing.   Husband and son had the specialty cut, 20 oz. Bone-In Tenderloin (46.00) Wedge salad/ baked potato.   Both said it was the best steak they ever had. Done medium perfectly.  I had the broiled shrimp ($23.00)   French onion soup $1.50 extra. Very bland/ zucchini   Daughter had the Walleye ($22.00) Caesar salad/ baked potato. Best walleye she has ever had.  For dessert we had: Flour less chocolate Cake, Chocolate Carmel Tart, Pineapple upside Down Cake. $8.00 each.   Great attentive staff. Could use brighter bulbs in lamps by tables.  Woman's bathroom very old looking but clean

Pretty good old school supper club. I went there Saturday and called friday for a reservation and was told it was my lucky day they just had a 6:30 cancel and I could have that spot or it would be after 9pm before I could get in. I  said great but 6:30 would be close and the response was as long as you within 10 minutes you will be good. We really wanted a 7 or 7:30 reservation. So We were able to arrive at 6:15 check in and said we would like a cocktail at the bar 1St and they responded by saying we will come get you in 15. I responded could you give us 20 minutes. His response I will get you in 15. Hmmm not very friendly. They were very slow and I noticed multiple customers walking in with no reservation being told they could be seated at 7:00 and or 7:30. Hmmmm again that was when we wanted. I guess they fooled me and got me to do what they wanted. So much for trying to be a good customer planing ahead.  In fact as I write this review I'm contemplating my 3 star is way to good and will be changing it to a 1 based on how customer service treated us. we rushed to make it on time and early and there was no need to. Tricked again I guess.

Went for dinner on a Tuesday evening. We spent some time in the bar area before our dinner was ready and the bartender was pleasant and conversational. Drinks we're made quickly and efficiently. For dinner I had the filet with a wedge salad and asparagus. All were prepared perfectly and delicious. No complaints with anything.

It's been awhile since I've eaten here, but I have the utmost respect for the bartenders here. It is not hyperbole to say that you could travel the world over and not find yourself a more perfect bloody mary. Watch how many ingredients they put into it. Notice that time after time, no matter who makes it, it never disappoints.  The bartenders here are bartenders in the true classic sense, not 'mixologists' or snotty hacks in the back pocket of the orange bitters lobby (see also Bourban and Branch in SF)...This same quality is found in all their drinks. This place is a real class act.

We came to Tornado on a Friday night on a whim with no reservation so didn't have very high hopes of being seated- but why not try?!  There was room at the bar and from there one of the small bar booths opened up quickly- perfect!!    We ordered a shrimp cocktail to start and it was fine- no frills and 5 jumbo shrimp.  We then got a bread basket and while the large breadstick was delicious, the small loaf was impractical and challenging to eat.  I ordered the sautéed perch special and my husband had a steak.  For sides we had yellow beets and hash browns.  I didn't try his steak but my dinner was delicious...especially from a place specializing in steak.  I was really impressed with how light the coating/breading was and the yellow beets were delicious!!  We will try our seating tactic again soon as it super fun to people watch in the bar!  Thanks Tornado!

My wife and I hit this place up for a dinner date. Amazing food and the atmosphere is like a Northwoods supper club, but with class. Kind of a throwback to the Rat Pack days.  We enjoyed an amazing shrimp cocktail with a bottle of wine for dinner.  Both of us had the special, which was a Wisconsin Grass-fed Beef 16oz steak and it was amazing. Just like a normal supper club, they throw tons of food at you. Next to my great steak was a baked potato and soup. Plus there is bread on the table as well.   And, they got my steak just the way I ordered. That's a big thing for me is the cooking of the steak. If I say medium, I want medium, not medium well or medium done, medium. And they got it perfect, compared to some of the other places in town.  This is a great place to have a romantic dinner.

The bartender says it has been open since 1996!  Did not know about this place until about 3 years ago and finally got the chance to go today.  This has an old 1960's typical Wisconsin supper club feel.  We had prime rib with yorkshire pudding  and filet au poivre.  These steaks are well presented, perfectly done and taste wonderful!  Our server knew her menu items well.  The fresh baked bread and butter was melt in your mouth.  The wine and cocktail selection is extensive. Compliments to Tornado!

Q: "You can go anywhere for your birthday. Where to?" A: "Tornado."  Q: "Who has the best steaks in Madison?" A: "Tough question. Can't go wrong with Tornado."  Q: "It's late. I'm hungry. Who has the best late night bar menu?" A: "Tornado."  Q: "I want an up North Supper Club feel without driving way outside of Madison." A: "Tornado."  Q: "What's a solid place for group of 6/8 near the square, and we hit drinks afterwards?" A: "Tornado."  Love Henry Doane's food so much we asked him to cook for our wedding twelve years ago. This is why five stars were invented for Yelp reviews.

My favorite steak house in Madison. I have to come hungry, but the bone in sirloin is amazing and always cooked appropriately to order and not overdone.  French onion soup and wedge salad are great pairings.  I love the ambiance. Great place for a drink as well

This place was was fabulous!  I was on a trip for business with several other co-workers - we heard that Tornado was a good place to get a steak.  It definitely was exactly what we were looking for.  I had a fabulous steak and salad.  The ambiance was like a supper club of past times, so it was very fun to go to.  The service was A+! I can't wait to go back again!

Wow!  I seriously had the most tender steak of my whole life here.  And it was local, grass fed, organic - Madison style, so I didn't even feel guilty about it.   Great, sort of vintage vibe in the restaurant - with booths in a bar area that must date back to the roaring 20s or something, and tables in a wood-laden separate room that just screamed classy and Midwestern at the same time.  Great for couples on dates and small groups.  I knew I would have to shell out some serious dough for this place - but the bill was still less than L'Etoile and worth every penny.  I'll be back as soon as I can afford it again (probably another year on a grad student budget)!

I was a little confused when I walked in the bar side and didn't know where to go and no one greeted us.  I loved the history of the building, but the bar stools are uncomfortably low and I am 6'4.  The bar staff must not be used to taking orders because they had to ask 4 times what we ordered.  That stuff doesn't really bother me, I just noticed it, what really matters to me is the steak!  I ordered the bone in ribeye and it was good, no complaints.  I'm not a fan of the house cut because it is so thick it's hard to cook it consistently.  I'm a fan, but didn't knock my sox off.

I've eaten here twice.  Once for a Friday night fish fry.  Another for a late night dining experience.  Both times it was lights out.  Great service, great food, and respectable prices.  Will definitely stop back here again!

I've been here for the late night menu before and greatly enjoyed it, but this past Friday night was the first time I was here for the main dining room. OMG, it was amazing.   It was graduation weekend and we didn't have reservations which meant an hour wait for the main dining room, or 5-10 minute wait for the patio. Uh, patio please. It was a beautiful night out, and the patio is decorated with lights and has a very nice ambiance. I don't know why others didn't opt for the patio, since the main dining room seemed a madhouse with all the graduates and their families.   In the 5 minutes we were waiting, we ordered cocktails. Since we were seated so quickly, the bartender found us at our table and transferred our bar tab. Now, I love single malt scotch and I love a well made single malt scotch cocktail - one that enhances the flavors of the scotch rather than mask it. And the Tornado Steak House had a cocktail that uses one of my favorite single malts (Ardbeg 10 yr). It was amazing. It had all the savory notes of the Ardbeg along with the big smokiness, the citrus notes and tartness. It was amazing and I will definitely come here just for the cocktail.   I ordered the 16 oz New York strip, and the boyfriend ordered the 28 oz bone in ribeye. All their entrees come with soup/salad and a side. I ordered the French Onion for an extra upcharge and the bf ordered the clam chowder. Both were delicious. The French Onion was rich, slightly sweet, and robust in flavor. The gruyere and french bread complemented the soup rather than smothered the soup as is often the case. The clam chowder is also delicious. It was rich with a delicate briny flavor. The bread is also really tasty. There was a mini loaf of rosemary bread that was crusty with a soft warm center. The breadstick covered with toasted sesame seeds was my favorite.   Then the entrees came, and man, so much meat. 16 ounces is a lot of meat and it was a thick slab on my plate, but heavenly melt in the mouth salty bites. I got through about a third of the steak and was so stuffed by the end. Definitely doggy bags were needed.   This place is delicious and amazing and highly highly recommended. Great place for special occasions.

Sorry, has been a good place in the past but their care for the customer has gone down. We had a reservation but were seated 45 minutes late without the least bit of an apology. Now, I understand 15-20 minutes off but not 45. Also, they were out of baked potatoes. OUT?!? How is this possible? "Hey Phil, we're down to 13 potatoes." "Well, put some more in the oven!" There, problem solved. I won't be returning. Plenty of other steak joints downtown similar in cost and quality that actually appreciate your business.

We went to Tornado Easter Sunday to celebrate my brother-in-laws birthday -  a group of 6 with one preteen.  We were seated in a semi-private room between the bar and the front entrance which was nice for a larger group.  Nick our server greeted us and explained the menu and specials,  and gave us time to  figure out our orders.  He was friendly and informative without being overbearing.   Four of us ordered steak which was excellent - but I think we were jealous of the two who didn't....  my husband who ordered the venison and my mother-in-law who ordered the walleye.  Everyone agreed that the walleye was perhaps the best thing on the table with the venison being a close second.  In addition the market vegetable that night, a braised fennel with a cabernet balsamic reduction was unusual and delicious.  Finally even though we had birthday cake before going to dinner,  my niece convinced us to order one piece of the lemon - blueberry cheesecake and I am glad she did because it was awesome.  A light lemony cheesecake with lots of plump fresh blueberries...  a perfect ending to a great dinner.  The only thing that marred the experience slightly was a distinct cigarette smoke smell that wafted through our area about halfway through the meal.  I think they had the doors open to get some cross-ventilation and we're bringing in smoke from people smoking outside the restaurant.   All in all a way better choice than traditional Easter brunch!

Atmosphere: Excellent Dale the Host: Arrogant and Dismissive Wait Staff: Marginally Adequate. Disconnected Food: Better than Average, NOT Exceptional Overall Experience:  DISAPPOINTING  I run a large business and understand the value in treating customers with respect. The experience begins when you walk through the door. The host should have been my indicator to turn around and walk right back out. We didn't, based on recommendations from locals.   The experience is all inclusive and not based solely on the food. The Tornado Room did not deliver. We will not return. There are too many other options in the area.

I have few favorites in Madison that never change.  One of them is the Tornado Room.  The steaks are tender and flavorful. I still feel this restaurant is in the top 5 for Madison.  I can't think of a time when I walked out of this place unsatisfied.

Good drinks, plus you can't go wrong with the steak sandwich in their late night menu  Went to Tornado on my birthday night with a couple of friends and the bartender who's name I do not remember was great!!
One of the best steak restaurants in Madison.  Friendly service.  Cozy atmosphere.  They also have great cocktails and the bartenders know what they're doing.

On a visit to my alma mater this past weekend I was originally headed to Smoky's Club for dinner until my friend redirected us to Tornado Steak House and am I glad he did. Walking into the place, I knew I was in a real supper club/steak house.  While we waited for a table I had the pleasure of watching the bartender make the best bourbon old fashioned I have ever had.  It was painstakingly made with no shortcuts whatsoever, including a generous pour of hootch. The menu had a lot of tantalizing choices but I was mentally on the steak train and ordered the ribeye.  Again, an excellent choice. Charred on the outside, juicy and perfect on the inside.  A side of asparagus and hash browns and my night was made.  Friendly, knowledgeable server, great atmosphere and great food.  This place has it all.

Tornado Club is the quintessential Wisconsin supper club, and the spot we chose for our one dinner in Madison over the holiday weekend. My bf, who hails from Madison, had been here when it was originally Crandall's.  To be honest, there were other places I would have liked to have tried, but since it was a Monday after a holiday, many places were closed. Not too much of a surprise since many restaurants here are not chains and instead are family-owned and operated. The decor is exactly what you'd expect from a supper club: dark wood, lots of booths, and dim lighting. There's a bar in the front of the restaurant but is separate from the dining area. The bar had a nice crowd which seemed to have a lot of regulars.  We got comfy and looked over the wine and cocktail list. I had had my fair share of wine over the holidays so we decided to enjoy cocktails instead. They had a special list of wintry cocktails and while the "Molly Ringwald" caught my eye, I didn't care for the ingredients in it. Instead I chose "Twinkling Lights", which was sparkling cider, clove honey, and lemon juice. My bf chose a twist on a classic Old Fashioned, which came with a garnish of Door County cherries, which he very nicely relinquished to me.  My cocktail was delicious and was exactly what I was in the mood for. The spice from the clove honey added a little kick and kept the drink from being too sweet.  Since the Tornado is, first and foremost, a steak house, it behooved me to order a bone-in ribeye. I immediately had second thoughts because it could never compare to my beloved Joe's, but I thought I'd be daring. My bf ordered the walleye pike which came with a lemon-caper butter reduction.  Entreés come with a choice of French onion soup (for a slight upcharge). soup of the day, or a salad (caesar, mixed greens, iceberg wedge). I opted for the mixed greens and he went with the iceberg wedge as he was intrigued that it came with French dressing. He wanted to keep with the retro theme that this place has in spades.  The salads were just fine. We were amused at the French dressing as neither of us have seen it since we were wee kids  - back when the only two dressing choices were French or oil and vinegar.  We ordered another round and our main courses arrived. I thought my steak was a bit underseasoned and not juicy enough, but once I added some salt and pepper, it tasted better. I had serious food envy though, after I tasted the walleye. It was flaky and rich and cooked perfectly. On the side I had a baked potato (not hot enough) and he had green beans almandine (again, another retro throwback).  Despite being full, once we saw that creme caramel was on the dessert menu, we had to order it. Since they don't offer espresso or cappuccino, we had to settle for coffee.  The creme caramel had a nice silky texture, but it was just a little too sweet for me. Allow me to toot my own horn for a minute here, but I just so happen to make a flawless creme caramel and I have to say, mine is better than the one the Tornado Club serves up.  Dinner was lovely and the service was warm and efficient. We  enjoyed ourselves and will definitely keep this spot in mind for our next trip to Madison.
My favorite steakhouse in Madison. Consistently above average food and service meshed with a classic steakhouse atmosphere make it a top spot in town.   Want a good drink and a great steak? Go. Now.

I went to dinner with a large party from work.  We were all travelling for training and had been told this was a must for dinner during our stay.  The drive up you see the capital building directly in front and it is very impressive.  The décor is definitely vintage, like old time 60's style, it is dark and lots of wood.  We had a small room for our large party and the staff did a great job of serving all of us together.  I had a filet that was cooked to perfection.  I also had a salad and the hash brown.  It was amazing.  I wished they had a smaller portion because I can never finish even a small filet.   It was outstanding.

The late night menu and 5 banquette tables in the bar of this traditional steakhouse make this place into just about the greatest location for hanging in Madison.  It's so good I wish it were a secret.

The roasted half chicken = GREAT! The mashed potatoes & green beans were very good, as well. The stuffing was good, but could have been better in flavor. The service was great. The bread options & Caesar salad was delish, as well. No complaints, really. The environment of the restaurant was nice - I love the level of privacy in the booths. The bar environment was very moody, dark, and retro - divine!

Super cool place to grab a late night bite and drinks! After 10 PM they have a late night menu with food ranging from around $8-$15. Super good menu to taste their food for cheap!   We tried the steak and the salmon sandwich on the late night menu. Both were delicious and next time I'm definitely going to try the scallops.   I would recommend this place for anyone going on a cute date or wanting a place to get late night dinner and drinks. The ambiance is what makes it amazing on top of the food! It's first come first serve seating too.

The food is a bit pricey, but FINALLY I found a place that cuts steaks the way they were intended. THICK and GORGEOUS!  The decor for the place is a bit ugly, as well as terrible lighting, but casting that aside the food was delicious. My steak was a masterpiece, perfect thickness, cooked correctly, well seasoned. They bring a selection of breads to the table and offer either a soup or a salad with your meal. I wish they offered more appetizers since I am not a fan or escargot or frog legs. The waiter was kind and attentive. The prices are a bit high, but well worth it for a good steak done right.

What a fun evening. Thanks Bob, Theresa, Dale...and everyone at Tornado Steak House and Corral Room Bar. With so many dining choices in Madison, we were directed to the Tornado Steak House by Wisconsin Supper Clubs by Ron Faiola. Another great suggestion Ron. Owner Henry D has captured the traditional Wisconsin supper club experience with some flair at Tornado Steak House. Relish tray served "vertical" - check. Round "vegas styled" booths for intimate service in the bar - check. Perfectly mulled Brandy Old Fashioned - check. Tornado Steak House is located in the former Crandalls, and named for the infamous Spring and Summer Wisconsin storms that equally capture the attention of locals. Starting with an email and a message/ Facebook - Bob the GM was efficient, communicative and very responsive, working diligently to squeeze us in for a Saturday evening reservation - viola - a cancellation and Bob was quick to accommodate us. We arrived early and sat in the cozy circular booths - graciously welcomed with a Jack and Coke , Brandy and Southern Comfort Old Fashioned(s) - perfectly mulled and served in heavy cocktail tumblers - "old school" - also a couple of Karben 4, Nightcall Porter(s) - served cold and quickly with attention to detail. Appetizers of Escargot and Coquille Saint Jacques - perfectly prepared, the sea scallops are poached in white wine and served with Wisconsin cream - excellent. For dinner, three of us enjoyed the Saturday special cuts of house prepared Prime Rib and the fourth enjoyed a deliciously prepared fillet of Walleye. Dinners were served with a choice of salad - wedge w/ roquefort dressing, mixed greens and vinaigrette, or tossed spinach w/ hot bacon dressing. I had the wedge and thought it was served perfectly chilled with just the proper amount of roquefort and french - tasty. Salads were preceded by the "vertical" relish offering and although our bread tray was forgotten, it was quickly retrieved when we inquired. Entree's were served with the Tornado Steak House famously delicious hash browns - and Yorkshire pudding - correctly executed in their preparation and served next to the nicely seasoned prime. If you are grading supper clubs on location, ambiance, hospitality, service, charisma, food, presentation, "x-factor", and value - I believe you'll find Tornado Steak house will score very high on your scorecard - I know it did on ours. Thanks Tornado Steak house for creating an authentic Wisconsin Supper Club experience that we thoroughly enjoyed. Stop by and visit Tornado Steak House soon, I'll think you'll enjoy the experience as much as we did.
Came back here with my fiancé! The rib eye steak is still my favorite and the scallops! So yummy! I wish they would make one in Southern California!!
Outstanding!  We have been here several times now and the food is always awesome.  The steaks melt in your mouth and the hashbrowns are the best.  I love the decor,  very cozy.

A nice option for high-end eating. They offer, what I would imagine to be, standard menu options for a traditional steak house.  Moderate drink and appetizer selections. The atmosphere is quite romantic and the wait staff does a wonderful job. The steak I had was great, flavor-wise, I just wish you would get a more plentiful portion for the price you're paying.  Rumor has it you can stop in late night and get a great deal on steak sandwiches. Would love to know if that's true...  Worthy of a return visit!
Absolutely phenomenal dining experience from the service to the outstanding steak, breads and sides that accompanied our meals. I can't wait to visit again on my next trip out that way. Loved it!
Everything we had was delicious! Only downside was that we had to still wait about 20 minutes with having a reservation.

Came here for my husband's birthday dinner during our weekend away in Madison. There were highs: the bread, the GIANT crab legs, the cheesecake. There were things below our expectations: the drinks, my husband's steak. Everything was still pretty good, but service was a bit slow and our meal was expensive considering we have had much better drinks and steaks elsewhere. It was still a successful dinner, but we will probably try a different steak place next time.

Ask anyone in town who is a local where to go eat steak, and invariably this place comes up. Walk in the place, and you may have to check to see if you are in the right place. When I first walked into place back in 2005, I was miffed as one side of the place is the dive-st looking bar, and the other is the steakhouse. We turned around and walked out, but after hearing for years how good this place is, I had to go back.   Go here if the steak is important, and the aesthetics are not. If you are looking for a much nicer LOOKING place, then go to Delmonico's, not far away. Everyone I ate with at the Tornado loved their meal (2 steaks, one fish), as did I. Champagne Dan, bartender extraordinaire and food lover to the max (@ the Concourse Hotel - Shout Out to CHAMPAGNE!) recommended either the Venison, or the Flank steak, which he claimed is the owner's favorite. I got the venison, accompanied with a side of hash browns, which may sound strange, but they were damn good and crispy. Haven't eaten much deer in my day, but it was pretty good.   Bottom line - if you want steak, here is your place.
My favorite steakhouse in Madison. Always a perfect medium rare. The baked potatoes are great too. Their cocktails are always a surprise. The late night menu is excellent; top notch in Madison.
Only went here once, but it was phenomenal - had the Lamb Chops with mint jelly - a classic that they did well.  I'll definitely be back.

After three trips to Tornado I've decided on two stars.  Pros:  Old school atmosphere, sides included, great lighting, comfortable bar.  Cons:  Waitstaff knows nothing about wine (literally), steaks are below average quality for the price, service in general feels more like a pub than somewhere that serves $45 pieces of beef.    Honestly I'll probably pay a few more bucks for a real steak at a place like...well...I guess that's the issue in Madison...Flemings is stupid overpriced and Delmonicos is hit-or-miss.    Overall Tornado is uniquely Madison and has its pluses.  But when I'm spending that much money I expect a little better service and quality.

Truly a classic - when you go in to this place you feel like you are stepping back into the 40's or 50's (especially when the weather is warm and you come in through the very dark bar area with the tiny curved booths and dozen bar stools).  We always make a point to dine here when attending a Badger football game and ALWAYS are sure to make a reservation well in advance.  I have probably eaten there 5 or 6 times and always enjoy the ambiance, service and food.  This is first and formost a steak place although there's usually one in the group that always gets the walleye (easily enough for two people).  Your steak will come on a sizzling hot plate with a nice crispy onion ring on top along with your choice of potatoes and soup or salad.  They've got a nice french onion soup but you really should have the classic wedge salad that comes with both french and blue cheese dressing.  Be careful because the meal also comes with a huge bread basket with about 5 diffferent types of bread and rolls - I especially like the foot long sesame bread sticks.  Also, right after you sit down someone will place a tall water glass on the table with a couple of carrot sticks, celery, pickle and olives.  They've got a decent wine list, but are also adept at all the classic cocktails like old fashions (a Wisconsin tradition).  Definitely one of the better steak houses in the area.

Celebrated my 40th birthday here with no regrets.  From the relish tray (served in a icy pint glass) to the homemade breads to the soups/salad/entrees, this restaurant proudly embraces the "supper club" moniker.  Delicious frog legs served in a citrusy honey glaze.  I had the 28 oz bone-in ribeye and it was one of the better steaks I have eaten in a long time (close match to Prime at the Bellagio).  I have had their late night menu often and was reminded that I need to come more often.  Top notch.

Terrible service at a recent visit.  It was a Monday around 7ish and my co-worker and I walked in to this place.  We didn't have a reservation as we just flew in to town.  But we saw all the empty tables so we thought were good.  Asked the hostess for a table for 2.  She said the wait time will be about 30 minutes.  And we're like OK no problem.  Then we saw the empty tables outside as well.  So I asked her again if the wait time is still 30 minutes if we are to sit outside?  Surprisingly she still said yes.  So we're out there sitting and after about 30 minutes she comes out and asks "oh did you want to just eat out here?".  And we're like - uhmmm yeah???  Unless I was speaking Martian, I swear I remember telling her that some 30 mins earlier.  I decided to skip the steak and instead got the salmon.  My buddy got the steak.  He said the steak was disappointingly dry.  The salmon I had was too greasy.  Very lousy food.  In my opinion I can maybe cut them some slack on the lousy food if their service wasn't terrible.  Why the F would they let us sit outside for 30 mins with 10s of empty tables?  Is it because we're too casual for their "crowd"?  Maybe because were not wearing suits?  Or maybe they just don't give a F*** about people who just walk in without a reservation?  This used to be a must-stop for me whenever I go to Madison.  This is now on my must-avoid and do-not-recommend list.

Please consider replacing your front door. Last night our dinner was considerably less enjoyable than usual as the door doesn't close all the way and we were either freezing or getting up every 3-5 minutes to close it. This exact thing happened to me a few years back. At the very least treat your customers who are left to do this chore to a shift drink for their work.

This is my go-to restaurant when I am craving a good steak.  I love the ambiance, reminds me of the upscale north shore Chicago supper clubs that I would go to with my grandparents. Unlike many supper clubs the wood paneling is not tacky but warm. More like Ralph Lauren lodge meets supper club.  It feels very cozy on a cold Wisconsin night.   The real draw for me is the steaks. There are a lot of places in the area that make a good steak but this is hands down my favorite. I order the same thing every time because it is beyond perfect.   Old Fashioned  French onion soup Spinach salad Filet Au Poivre in mushroom cream sauce Hash browns  I always have leftovers and unlike 90% of leftovers in my fridge I actually look forward to them.

I had heard rave reviews about Tornado's late night menu.  Friday night, a group of us came in for their famous late night steak sandwiches.  About half the tables in the room were full at this point.  We waited at least 10 minutes for menus/any communication from our server.  Once we received our menus, our server told us they would be back to take our order soon- this ended up being 10 more minutes..  We ordered drinks and food, and also asked for water for the table.  After ordering, we waited 45 more minutes and still hadn't received water or the drinks we ordered!  Our server ignored our table the entire time.  When we asked nicely about the wait for the drinks, the server replied with "We only have one bartender..." and then went on and was very defensive.  After asking, our drinks and food came out together and two of our parties orders were missing...we couldn't ask about them, because our server was nowhere to be seen again.  We still had not been given water and there were people at our table who didn't order drinks either and had been there for an hour with nothing to drink.   Also, a friend in our party had food allergies, particularly green onion.  When she asked the server about her options, the server basically told her that "the kitchen is covered in green onion" and there was nothing she could do to help her. and was very put off by the thought of a customer even asking for alternative options.  The steak sandwich was good, when it finally came, but the service was just terrible.  I hardly ever am disappointed with restaurants in Madison, but I was definitely disappointed after all of the hype.

This is the most popular restaurant and bar in Madison right now, according to a bunch of chefs and bartenders I ended up meeting, and it is so for all good reasons. It is a classic steakhouse supper club that's been unchanged for decades, but the wood is all warmly polished, the dim coloured lights are in perfect condition and the menu, though completely classic, is cooked with total love, impeccable quality and attention to detail. Some menu items are weirdsville to me - the giant chunk of iceburg lettuce slathered in blue cheese and French dressing, the deep fried cheese curds, the steak all alone on a hot plate topped with a single enormous onion ring. All sort of bizarre to this Montrealer, but that was honestly probably the best steak I've ever eaten, and the cocktails and local microbrews were just perfect too. We ate at a small table in a cozy black booth in the front bar and it was cozy and perfect.   Funny sidenote: Later in the week I was having a beer in another great bar in Madison (great in a completely different divey way) and I started chatting with the gent next to me and it turned out he had actually cooked my amazing steak at the Tornado Room! So shout out to Kalyb, give that man a raise!

My husband and I came here at least once a week while we lived in Madison. The steak sandwich on the late night menu is heaven and their drinks are always deliciously boozy. We moved out of state a year ago and still miss it. Absolutely one of the best the city has to offer!

My first visit here was about ten years ago. I'd had many a steak at many a steakhouse in my day, but I declared their sirloin steak the best I'd ever had. I also recall that the several visits back in the day required having dinner at the bar, because reservations were booked (especially during the academic year) months in advance. This time, I ate the bar too.  I love the decor, the vibe, and the sheer retro independent personality of the place. Walking in from the street through a cramped little doorway, you kind of feel like you're in New York. Then as you enter, you might be in some Rat-pack-themed, vintage martini, Quentin Tarantino movie, At 10PM on a weeknight, and you'd think it was a Saturday night, from the number of patrons and the general festive air. Friendly barkeeps and patrons make for a unique experience.  My first time here, I had the sirloin dinner. I washed it down with classic dirty martini.That was nothing short of perfection. Recently I tried the wedge salad and the steak sandwich from the budget-friendly late night menu. The wedge is more of a retro art project than a serious salad as to flavors or nutrition. It is after all made with a chunk of iceberg. But the sandwich was the best steak sandwich ever. Nestled in a soft hamburger-sized bun, it was full of what must have been beef tenderloin dressed with what I love most with tenderloin, a horseradish cream sauce. I felt like I was making love to that sandwich, and it was loving me back. I never got around to dipping it in the au jus, because it was already so luscious and moist. Salad, sandwich and a beer ran around $21.00 sans tip.   Service by both bartenders (and by the way, thanks for having two available, Mr. or Mrs. Tornado) was fast, friendly and welcoming. The food came quickly. Tornado at night was just a great value and a fun way to spend time catching up with a fellow Yelper at the bar. After 10 years, still a favorite spot in Madison or Wisconsin, for that matter, for steaks and cocktails.

This was the first "nice" steakhouse I had ever been to in Madison. I was just a teenager, but I always thought this HAD to be the best steakhouse around. Fast forward to today. I have now been to nearly all of the upscale steakhouses in town. Tornado is still my favorite in terms of atmosphere. I love the old timey supper club vibe. It is warm, inviting and inclusive. In terms of food, it's not my absolute favorite, but definitely in my top 5. The steak is SO flavorful and always cooked perfectly. I love that they offer Yorkshire pudding, that's not something you see very often. My only gripe is the freaking HUGE portions of some of the cuts. Ribeye is my favorite cut to order, but Tornado only offers it at a whopping 28 ounces!!!! Why? I can't even eat 1/3 of that, it's absurd. They do have some more reasonably sized options, but not in the cuts that I prefer. I would definitely appreciate a smaller option that would be a little less intimidating to tackle, Plus the size (obviously) adds a hefty amount to the price tag. It just seems excessive to me. Regardless, I can't wait to go back. I love this place.
An amazing steak and the cuisine takes me back to the fifties suppler club era.  The service was good and I will definitely return

I really wanted to enjoy an evening with my fiancé at Tornado after not seeing him for 3 weeks. We were seated in a large room with 7 other tables occupied. A large group of women came in and were practically yelling in the restaurant. Other tables clearly looked as frustrated as us, but none of the wait staff asked the group to quiet down a bit. We left frustrated and annoyed and would have stayed longer for more drinks and dessert had the wait staff been more attentive to "all" of their guests.

This place lives up to what I'v heard thus far about the best steak in town.  From the outside, the place looks fairly sketchy. On the inside, the atmosphere borders between a log cabin and a 1950s supper club. The waitstaff are friendly, down to earth, and knowledgeable. Tornado mixes the down to earth qualities of a supper club with touches (wine and food) of a high class steak house.  I had the 16oz NY Strip. It's served sizzling on a metal plate with an onion ring on the top. A very nicely seasoned excellent cut of meat that was perfectly cooked.  Also Jim, one of the bartenders, is the best.

The Tornado Room is incredible! It might be the best steakhouse in Madison, with a superb filet mignon and great sides. Also, check out their late night menu after 10pm! They have an amazing steak burger and the prices drop a lot compared to their normal dinner menu. Great service, great food, great place!

I often enjoy Tornado Room after work which happens to fall under the late night menu. The menu offers a good variety of smaller dishes at reasonable prices. Great food though the service leaves much to be desired. I went in with a co-worker who requested coffee. She was not eating and was along to keep me company. The server, (Cassandra K.), proceeded to tell us she had already dumped the pot and she (my friend)didn't want it anyways because it was hours old. I responded  by asking if I could buy a POT of coffee and smiling. At this point, my friend spoke up and said she no longer wanted any coffee and Cassandra K. proceeded to walk away. Having both served and bartended previously, I was genuinely surprised by the poor service we received. I expected better from a classy joint like Tornado room. I will go back but I will try to visit earlier so that I will hopefully get a more professional server.

Good and service were quite average. Food wasn't served warm and the quality of cooking was low where hash browns were burnt and asparagus was mushy. I would not recommend this place if you'd like a nice steak place.

My favorite restaurant in Madison, may be even ever!  I've been here several times for both dinner and for the late night menu and have gladly given them hundreds of my hard earned dollars. In return, I have received food memories to last a life time.   My Favorite Items: Filet au Poivre- The cognac cream sauce it is served with will blow your mind!  Coquille Saint Jacques- The scallops are always perfectly cooked. The whole dish is very well balanced. It's so good you will want to curl up in the shell it's served on and go into a food coma. You can also get this on the late night menu  Steak Sandwich- I like to get the horseradish cream on the side, because I'm a little bit of a wuss and I like to self apply saucy business.  Dinner is served with an edible centerpiece (made of veggies) and a giant plate of a variety of breads.  The service has always been very good every time I've been. A great combo of great service and great food.   I would definitely recommend making a reservation.
honestly i think its way overpriced for what they're serving.  very dim lighting, tiny dining area.  new york strip wasn't anything impressive for its cost.

Low key steak house with some classic vibe.  The "house cut" 21oz tenderloin ($45) done medium rare was tasty and tender for the most part.  It did get a more veiny and fibrous on the areas near the bone which were more rare.  Service was pretty good with menu knowledge, refilling drinks, taking away dirty dishes, and serving the food.  My dinner companion got a "well done" filet ($38) that didn't come out like jerky.  There was some pink in the middle and the filet was easy to cut and chew. I saw an order of lab shank thank looked very interesting as well.   Overall, the flavors where tasty without being too salty.  The bread was fresh and warm, and the other sides were on par for any similar type of establishment. The unassuming entrance sets you up to be pleasantly surprised. Definitely worth a try in the Madison area.  (4/27/11) Revising to 3 stars from 4 after my second visit.  The service remained good but the meat was overcooked.  People in my party ordered filet and sirloin medium well that turned out to be very tough and dry.  I'm sure medium-rare would have been much better but the texture and flavor was off tonight.  The rack of lamb has a very tasty sauce and the portion was good for $28.  The yorkshire pudding was a bit dry.
Great meal from the French onion soup, the four different steaks our party ordered, to the pineapple upside down cake for dessert! We have been here a few times and are always impressed.

I love this place so much. I remember when I first moved here I would walk by it all the time and pay it no mind. From the outside it always seemed a bit like a dive. How wrong I was!   For my second visit it was also during the hours where they have their late night menu. You can get an 8 oz sirloin for 13 bucks which is what I had my heart set on. It got me through the work week knowing that on Friday night I would be having an amazing steak. It's a great deal considering during normal hours their steaks will average 20 to 40 dollars.   Fried cheese curds were shared among the table. A friend thought they might actually be better than the old fashioned's cheese curds!   The French onion soup I had for an appetizer. It was good but not something I would order again.   Both times I've eaten downstairs and the ambiance is wonderful. Cozy, intimate, fun tunes, and great friendly waiting staff.

Tornado and I are late-night lovers. We don't ever see each other at an appropriate time, and when we do get together it's hot and heavy. Mostly in the way that I'm eating a gigantic sandwich and more steak fries than any cardiologist would recommend.   I happen to be one of those terrible people who likes all their meat well done (not burnt, mind you, but pink is for flowers, not meat). This prevents me from spending my money in a traditional steakhouse set-up because it pains the chef and my pocketbook to "ruin" the steak. The Tornado Room late night menu gives me a work-around. The steak sandwich is pretty thin and thus gets pretty cooked through, and their quality ground beef for the burgers doesn't beget the same side-eye when I ask for it well done.   For me, though, the star is the steak fries. They are probably my favorite fries in Madison. Part of it is their crispy exterior and creamy insides, and part of it is the tomato remoulade. Get on it, people. The horseradish cream is also quite tasty, but if I was forced to choose just one I'd pick the remoulade every time. I'm getting hungry just writing this.  Other things that I love about the Tornado is that it is stuck in time, especially the front bar and basement Corral Room. Old jukebox with mid-century records? Done. Rivet-heavy upholstery? Check. Lighting so dim no one can tell that you've dripped remoulade on your cocktail dress? They've got you covered. The prices on the late night menu also can't be beat - you're getting the same wonderful ingredients as the dining room but at a discount because you're bumping up the post-dinner rush or are coming in from a service industry job and deserve a nice meal at a reasonable price. Wonderful.

Best steak I've ever had.  Classic atmosphere. Eating here makes you feel like you could carve something out of wood or fix a car or actually impress your grandfather.  I had the house cut bone in filet and instantly grew a beard.   My dinner conversation suffered as I was reduced to grunts and moans for a lease 15 minutes.

Inconspicuous by day; the perfect hide-out by night!  The back entrance takes a quick spin directly into the "Tornado Room".  Grab yourself a bar stool, order a classic cocktail and get ready to eat some meat!  Hunker down, because that's exactly what your paying for; professional service, outstanding steaks, dark atmosphere, a 1960's bar experience and a rare Madison Tornado!

One of my Top 3 restaurants in the city. Perfect for that night you're craving a steak or other hearty item. A Madison classic.  Delicious food with a better value than other "fancy steakhouses" in the city, which is what I'm looking for.  Friendly staff, welcoming. Lively atmosphere, which can get a little noisy at peak times. There's a reason why this place gets busy!

We had been  anxiously anticipating our visit to Madison and were excited to try the Tornado having heard so much about it. The ambiance is like taking a step back in time. I almost expected Don Draper to be bellied up to the bar. Drinks in the bar were great. Well presented and delicious. Not a big gin repertoire but the old fashioned my husband and friend had did not disappoint. What did disappoint was the service.  We waited a full half hour after being seated before we saw a waiter. We had been  given water etc. but no server. We had to ask the water server for our waiter. The waiter took our order but that was about all he did.  Our friend asked for butter and that came after the meal was over. My husband asked for horseradish and that never came.  When we asked that our bill be split by couple he complied but added an automatic 18% gratuity which our friend vehemently disputed. It was then removed. I have never had such terrible service in a restaurant of this caliber. The food was delicious but with the many choices for cuisine in Madison, we will not be visiting this  establishment again.

Best steaks in town by far. Do not go to any of the crappy overpriced chains in Madison when you can go to the Tornado. I wish I could eat their meat every day of my life. It's also a fun place to go for cocktails.  The late night menu is so delicious that I can barely contain myself. Try the steak sandwich, the salmon sandwich and the onion rings.

Tornado is a must visit in Madison! We had the late night menu and got the wedge salad, steak and shared a shrimp cocktail. The shrimp cocktail was a pleasant surprise! The shrimp were huge and chilled just right and the homemade cocktail sauce was delicious. The steak was perfect as well, crispy and flavorful on the outside but cooked at a melt in your mouth medium rare on the inside.  We sat in the bar area at a cozy, intimate booth. The prices were right, you could taste exactly what you were paying for. If we lived in the area I think we would be regulars!

Went here with some co-workers during a convention.  The service was a little off, but the place was crowded with convention goers, so they may have not been staffed to handle all of us.  Everyone's order came out just right even with all the attendees there.

This was our go to steak house / supper club when we lived in madison. Been several years so we were happy (1) it was still here and (2) it still rocks. Bonus treat was we sat downstairs for the first time.  Its like its own club and has a frank Sinatra / Sammy Davis vibe.  Like either guy could just walk in at any time.   Food was solid as always. I had a 16 oz NY strip cooked and seasoned perfectly.  Wifey had 8 oz fillet. Hers was perfect too.   I splurged and had their world famous hash browns. Omg good. Mixed with steak jus its heaven on a plate.   If you are on the square stop on in.

I went to the Tornado room about a year ago and postponed writing a review for a while.  By the time I was set to finally review this joint I felt that I wouldn't be able to write a worthy review until I went back; so I did. I have to say that I do not know why it has taken me such a long time to go back because this place is phenomenal!  I made reservations which I think is something that is required if you are having dinner.  We got there a few minutes early so we had a drink at the bar.  I liked the vibe, nice and dark, great music but I wish it were a bit larger.   I found myself bumping into people and constantly getting tapped so someone could walk by.  I ordered the key lime gimlet which the man said used to be called to key lime martini and I was so happy with my choice!   When our table was ready the host found us and said that the bar tab could be transferred to our table; I thought this was a nice touch.   Our waiter was very nice, read the specials and was very patient while answering the questions that we had regarding some of  the menu options.  We decided on the Rockefeller oysters which is a broiled oyster with spinach, bread crumbs, cheese and what appeared to be bacon bits to start.  The man loved it; I thought it was a bit on the salty side however.  While seated the waiter also brought bread and crudites that were gobbled up before our meal arrived.    I ordered the 8 oz filet with brussel sprouts and potato leek soup.  My steak, I will say, was the best steak I have ever had.  As I type that I know it sounds a bit dramatic but I know in my heart that it is true.  It was perfectly cooked medium rare and very tender.  The soup was great as well.  My guest ordered the venison which he just could not stop raving about!  We tried each other dishes and argued about whose was better.  I still contend that mine was the best.    We ended our dinner with the cheesecake which, just like everything else that night, was amazing.  The waiter mentioned how all the desserts were cooked in house as well.  When the bill came it was as I thought it would be so no surprises there.  I don't know if we would be going to this place as often because it is a little on the pricier side but you definitely get your money's worth.  The Tornado Room has easily become my favorite steakhouse in the area.

Tornado is an unbelievable dining experience. After we were seated, an array of fresh, crispy vegetables was delivered. Our cocktails were made to order. After we ordered, a variety of breads arrived at the table. The escargot was satisfying. Next, Rob enjoyed a crock of french onion soup. I ate a salad of greens dressed with a delicious vineagrette. Rob's entree was duck breast medalions with a port wine currant reduction. I opted for the prime rib with yorkshire pudding. Both of us chose hash browns as our side. We also ordered coffee reminiscent of our trip to Europe.  The service was EXCELLENT as was our welcome by the front of the house. It was a great anniversary celebration.

Let me start out by saying i LOVE the decor in the bar area, and the restaurant reminds me of a classy version of our cabin in the nortwoods. Just one look and we knew that our food would be fantastic.  We had made reservations and were seated immediately. We sat down, ordered drinks and perused the menu. I ordered a spiced pear martini, which sounded good for some odd reason but I didn't love, and the waitress gladly took it back (and didn't charge me for it!). We didn't order an appetizer, opting to pick at the bread instead. The bread was fantastic - some kind of freshly baked rosemary loaf - but we tried not to fill up on it in order to save room for our steaks.  I started with the baked french onion soup, which was really, really good, and had the 8oz. filet with asparagus for my entree. This steak was aMAZing. (This is coming from a girl whose uncle raised beef cattle.) It was tender and juicy and perfectly seasoned with just a little salt and pepper.  My boyfriend ordered the peppercorn encrusted sirloin and he was grinning the entire time he was eating it.   We were totally stuffed but decided to order dessert anyway, since this was a birthday dinner. The ho-ho was sooooo good and somehow we found room for it.   I am not a huge steak eater most of the time, but dang... So good! You have to go here if you even sorta kinda like red meat.

The wife and I celebrated my birthday tonight at the Tornado Room.  Overall, very good, but a bit inconsistent and questionable when it came to value.    Atmosphere-- Loud and dark.  I  liked it, but I could see this being a turn-off for others.  Drinks- Excellent martinis and gimlets.  Bread-- Fantastic.  Appetizers-- very disappointing.  We split frog legs and escargot.  Both left a lot to be desired.  The frog legs were extremely bland-- both the batter and the meat itself seemed like they could have used more seasoning.  Not good.  Escargot was ok but certainly nothing to write home about.  I really liked the escargot at Nadia's when it was still open. These were really unremarkable.  I managed to push one of them into the shell and didn't even expend the effort to get it back out.  Wouldn't eat this again.  Salad and Soup-- My wife had the spring mix with balsamic vinaigrette.  She said it was very good.  I loved the French onion soup.  Steaks-- Excellent.  Wife had the 8 oz filet, which she really liked.  I had the tenderloin, which was also very good.  I liked the idea of the onion ring on top, but didn't love the onion ring itself-- as someone else said, it was almost doughnut like-- encrusted in a thick batter rather than a nice crispy coating.  I didn't love it, though the wife enjoyed it quite a bit..  I went for the hash browns, just because I saw them mentioned in so many reviews.  They were nothing special.  I would order a baked potato if I had to do it over again.  In any case, the meat had wonderful flavors, but was quite pricey.    Service- very good.  No complaints.  Unobtrusive and competent.    Overall, we both really enjoyed the meal, but for $160 (before tip) I think I could find better in Madison.  If we did it again, we'd skip the appetizers and probably be much more satisfied.    Finally, one complaint-- do you really need to charge $1.50 extra for french onion soup (instead of the soup du jour)?  Given the price of this place, this felt like I was being nickel and dimed.

If international conflict were determined by 1950's cocktails, I'm pretty sure Tornado's Old Fashioned could create world peace.   Muddled cherries, perfect bittered tartness, and brandy, because we're in Wisconsin, dammit!  Check out the late night menu, because you aren't going to be stuffing your face from 10pm-1am with this much class anywhere else.

I love that this place has late night eats. It's pretty much like a reverse happy hour, but for food. From 10pm to 1am in their bar and lounge area, you can get specially priced goodies like a steak sandwich for $8. Their bar area is really nice for a late night date. The lighting is dim and sexy. You will find yourself making out with someone like this one couple we saw. The sexy food and sexy lighting will guarantee that you can't keep your hands off each other.

All Wisconsin steak houses R not created equal. Went w hi expectations and was disappointed.. Jamie our server was great. The bread, salad, veg were all first rate.  The hash browns were greasy and the t-bone had good flavor but was chewy. Walleye was good but overall not up to standards. Smokey in Madison and Schwartz's in New Holstein R far superior choices. I can't imagine trying it again
We come for Friday Fish. This is the best $14 dish in town. Together with soup, bread, and two sides, it's really good deal.

Fun little place to visit as when you walk in you take a quick time warp back to the1970's. When you finally get to your table after enjoying your drinks at the bar,  you take a time machine back to the future to enjoy cutting edge fine dining.

My review is based on the late night menu/experience, and it was a good time! We didn't really want pizza, and instead opted to visit Tornado. The steak sandwich with au jus is pretty dang spectacular! Giving it 4 instead of 5 stars as service was a bit slow on a night that wasn't particularly busy.

ALWAYS perfect drinks, and if you're lucky, you'll catch them while they're experimenting at the bar.  I've been coming here for years, but honestly, everything I've eaten has been eclipsed by the amazing duck.  All other food is designed to keep me preoccupied while I wait for the duck.

Gods greatest gift to the world has got to be the late night steak sandwich from Tornado Room. I'm not sure if it's the horseradish, the jus, the tender steak, or the pillowy roll that does it, but it could be the greatest sandwich in the Madison area.
